metadata.Title: CVE-2018-0608 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in H2O version 2.2.4 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (DoS) via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-0608` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

h2o - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3build1
libh2o-evloop0.13 - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3build1
libh2o0.13 - 2.2.5+dfsg2-3build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: h2o package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.5+dfsg2-3build1').
